quizTitle: O-Level Physics: General Properties of Waves
instructions: Answer the following questions on wave fundamentals, properties, calculations, and basic ripple tank observations. Choose the correct answer.

questions.question: Which statement correctly describes a transverse wave?
options: The particles vibrate parallel to the direction of wave travel
The particles vibrate perpendicular to the direction of wave travel
It cannot travel through a vacuum
It has regions of compression and rarefaction
questions.explanation: In transverse waves, particle displacement is perpendicular to wave propagation direction (e.g., water ripples).

questions.question: In a longitudinal wave, regions where particles are close together are called:
questions.explanation: Compressions are high-pressure regions where particles are densely packed; rarefactions are low-pressure regions with spread-out particles.

questions.question: The amplitude of a wave is defined as:
options: The distance between two consecutive crests
The number of waves passing a point per second
The maximum displacement of a particle from its rest position
The time taken for one complete wave cycle
questions.explanation: Amplitude measures the maximum disturbance from equilibrium and relates to the energy carried by the wave.

questions.question: A wave has a frequency of 8 Hz and wavelength of 0.5 m. What is its speed?
questions.explanation: Using v = fλ: v = 8 Hz × 0.5 m = 4.0 m/s.

questions.question: In a ripple tank, circular wavefronts are produced when:
options: A straight bar vibrates on the water surface
A single point dipper vibrates on the water surface
Waves reflect from a curved barrier
questions.explanation: A point source (single dipper) creates circular wavefronts that spread outward equally in all directions.

questions.question: The period of a wave with frequency 25 Hz is:
questions.explanation: Period T = 1/f = 1/25 = 0.04 s. Period is the time for one complete oscillation.

questions.question: Which wave property is measured in hertz (Hz)?
questions.explanation: Frequency = number of complete waves passing a point per second. Unit: hertz (Hz) = waves per second.

questions.question: A wave travels 12 m in 4 seconds. Its speed is:
Which statement about waves is always true?
options: Waves transfer matter from one place to another
Waves transfer energy without transferring matter
All waves require a medium to propagate
Wave speed depends only on frequency
questions.explanation: Waves transfer energy through oscillations; particles vibrate about fixed positions but do not travel with the wave.

questions.question: In a displacement-distance graph of a transverse wave, the horizontal axis represents:
questions.explanation: Displacement-distance graphs show wave shape at an instant; horizontal axis = position/distance, vertical axis = displacement.

questions.question: A ripple tank shows circular waves spreading from a point source. The wavelength is measured as the distance between:
options: Centre of one circle to centre of next circle
Edge of one circle to edge of next circle
Centre to the first dark ring
questions.explanation: Wavelength λ = distance between two consecutive similar points (e.g., crest-to-crest or trough-to-trough), visible as bright-to-bright rings in ripple tanks.

questions.question: If the frequency of a wave doubles while its speed remains constant, what happens to its wavelength?
questions.explanation: From v = fλ, if v constant and f doubles, λ must halve to maintain equality.

questions.question: Which wave type can be demonstrated using a slinky spring stretched horizontally?
questions.explanation: A slinky can demonstrate transverse waves (side-to-side motion) and longitudinal waves (push-pull motion creating compressions).

questions.question: The highest point of a transverse wave is called a:
questions.explanation: Crest = highest point (maximum positive displacement). Trough = lowest point (maximum negative displacement).

questions.question: A wave has wavelength 2.0 m and speed 10 m/s. What is its frequency?
questions.explanation: Using v = fλ → f = v/λ = 10 m/s ÷ 2.0 m = 5.0 Hz.
